item.title: 收费逆转后，纽约交通局将搁置升级项目
item.description: 纽约州州长凯西-霍楚尔（Kathy Hochul）推迟了一项拥堵收费计划，该计划将为基础设施升级提供 150 亿美元的资金，以改善服务。【原文：New York City’s transit system may sideline key modernization projects after Governor Kathy Hochul delayed a congestion pricing program that would have financed $15 billion of infrastructure upgrades to improve service.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚禁止向以色列出售煤炭以寻求结束加沙战争
item.description: 哥伦比亚将禁止向以色列出口煤炭，以向本雅明-内塔尼亚胡总理的政府施压，迫使其结束加沙冲突。【原文：Colombia is set to ban coal exports to Israel in a bid to pressure the government of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyah to end the conflict in Gaza.】

item.title: 菲律宾因禽流感禁止从澳大利亚进口鸟类
item.description: 菲律宾最近发生禽流感病例后，已禁止从澳大利亚进口禽类和禽类产品。【原文：The Philippines has banned imports of birds and poultry products from Australia following recent cases of bird flu in the country.】

item.title: 彼得罗呼吁哥伦比亚银行利用廉价信贷促进经济增长
item.description: 哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-佩特罗（Gustavo Petro）呼吁全国顶级银行家通过发放低息贷款帮助重振国家经济。【原文：Colombian President Gustavo Petro called on a room of the nation’s top bankers to help reactivate the nation’s economy by doling out low-interest loans.】

item.title: 据《明星报》报道，菲律宾中央银行第二位官员提出辞职
item.description: 据《菲律宾星报》周六援引菲律宾中央银行一位不愿透露姓名的官员的话报道，菲律宾中央银行政策制定货币委员会的第二位成员提出辞职，原因是正在对该机构是否存在 "幽灵 "员工进行调查。【原文：A second member of the Philippine central bank’s policy-setting Monetary Board offered to resign amid an ongoing investigation into the presence of “ghost” employees at the institution, the Philippine Star reported on Saturday, citing an unidentified official at the Bangko Sentral ng Pilipinas.】

item.title: 新加坡洗钱丑闻中掌握资金最多的银行
item.description: 周五，在新加坡的一个法庭上，最后一名因卷入岛国最大洗钱案而被捕的人认罪，为 30 亿新元（22 亿美元）丑闻的下一步处理铺平了道路。【原文：In a Singapore courtroom on Friday, the last of those arrested for their involvement in the island nation’s biggest laundering case pleaded guilty, paving the way for the next steps in the S$3 billion ($2.2 billion) scandal.】

item.title: 大选后印度股票的莫迪溢价受到质疑
item.description: 近年来，看好印度股票的投资者以印度总理纳伦德拉-莫迪（Narendra Modi）领导下的政策改革承诺和快速经济增长为理由，证明印度股票相对于新兴市场同类股票创纪录的溢价是合理的。【原文：In recent years, investors bullish on Indian equities have cited the promise of policy reforms and rapid economic growth under Prime Minister Narendra Modi to justify its record premium over emerging-market peers.】

item.title: 中国超长期债券迎来八月以来波动最小的一周
item.description: 中国为抑制炙手可热的债券涨势所做的努力正在结出硕果，中国超长主权债券一度出现的剧烈波动已经烟消云散。【原文：China’s efforts to rein in a sizzling bond rally are bearing fruit, as once wild swings in the nation’s ultra-long sovereign notes have all but evaporated.】

item.title: 巴西财政部长讲话加剧财政忧虑，令资产剧烈波动
item.description: 巴西财政部长费尔南多-哈达德（Fernando Haddad）在周五下午与投资者会面时表达了对巴西财政前景的担忧，这导致资产价格暴跌，并引发了一场控制损失的公开尝试。【原文：Brazil Finance Minister Fernando Haddad expressed concern about the country’s fiscal outlook during a Friday afternoon meeting with investors, tanking assets and sparking a public attempt to contain the damage.】

item.title: 阿米乌斯称巴西税改将使大豆需求转向美国
item.description: 据风险管理公司 Amius Ltd. 的一份报告称，农业强国巴西令人吃惊的税收变化有可能使这个世界上最大的豆类出口国种植的大豆与美国供应的大豆相比竞争力下降。【原文：A surprising tax change in agriculture powerhouse Brazil has the potential to make soy grown in the world’s largest bean exporter less competitive with supplies from the US, according to a report from risk management firm Amius Ltd.】

item.title: KKR、CrowdStrike 和 GoDaddy 将加入 S&P 500 指数，实现指数再平衡
item.description: KKR & Co.Inc.、CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. 和 GoDaddy Inc. 将加入 S&P 500 指数，作为其最新季度权重变化的一部分。【原文：KKR & Co. Inc., CrowdStrike Holdings, Inc. and GoDaddy Inc. will join the S&P 500 as part of its latest quarterly weighting change.】

item.title: 贝莱德模式调整引发 40 亿美元增长型股票 ETF 激增
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）的一个目标配置模型团队正在增加对发达市场成长型股票的投资，向跟踪该行业的交易所交易基金投入数十亿美元。【原文：One of BlackRock Inc.’s target allocation model teams is increasing its growth-stock exposure across developed markets, plowing billions into exchange-traded funds that track the sector.】

item.title: 纳格尔称欧洲央行在通胀回落后降息合乎逻辑
item.description: 德国央行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧洲央行降息反映出欧元区 20 国的通胀态势有所改善。【原文：The European Central Bank’s interest-rate cut reflects improved inflation dynamics across the 20-nation euro zone, according to Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉债权人寻求摩根大通帮助竞购 70 亿美元的 Citgo 公司
item.description: 据熟悉这一过程的人士透露，委内瑞拉的一个债权人团体正在寻求摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：A group of Venezuela creditors is seeking funding from JPMorgan Chase & Co. in a $7 billion bid for the parent of Citgo Petroleum Corp., according to people familiar with the process.】

item.title: 惠誉称：阿波罗旗下 Brightspeed 的重组 "不可避免
item.description: 惠誉评级公司（Fitch Ratings）周五表示，阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）支持的互联网服务提供商 Brightspeed 近期将需要重组其债务负担。【原文：Apollo Global Management-backed internet provider Brightspeed will need to restructure its debt load in the near future, Fitch Ratings said Friday.】

item.title: 联合国在关于冲突中儿童的报告中同时提到以色列和哈马斯
item.description: 联合国将于近日发布一份报告，称以色列在保护武装冲突中的儿童权利方面做得不够。【原文：A UN report set to be released in the coming days will say Israel isn’t doing enough to protect the rights of children in armed conflict, the world body said, a conclusion that provoked a swift backlash from the country’s ambassador.】

item.title: 欧佩克+计划令对冲基金十年来最不看好原油走势
item.description: 在欧佩克（OPEC）及其盟国决定今年恢复部分原油生产后，对冲基金抛出了对布伦特原油的看涨押注，并增加了对全球基准原油的空头押注，使其看涨程度降至近十年来最低。【原文：Hedge funds dumped bullish bets on Brent crude and ramped up shorts against the global benchmark — sending their positioning to the least bullish in almost a decade — after OPEC and its allies decided to revive some production this year.】

item.title: 选股人试图只下几注就赢大钱
item.description:
主动型股票 ETF 的集中度正在提高

。【原文：

Active equity ETFs are becoming more concentrated

item.title: 页岩钻探活动降至 2022 年以来最低水平
item.description: 美国页岩地区的钻井数降至近两年半以来的最低水平，因为运营商誓言兑现对投资者的承诺，今年的产量增长将受到抑制。【原文：Drilling in the US shale patch dropped to the lowest level in almost two-and-a-half years as operators vow to make good on promises to investors for subdued production growth this year.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长拉加德表示抗击高通胀的斗争尚未结束
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）表示，欧洲央行与通胀的斗争尚未结束，尽管欧洲央行本周降低了借贷成本，但官员们仍需保持警惕。【原文：The European Central Bank’s fight against inflation isn’t over yet and officials need to remain vigilant although they lowered borrowing costs this week, President Christine Lagarde said.】

item.title: 迫于财政压力，哥伦比亚将在 2024 年预算中削减 50 亿美元
item.description: 哥伦比亚财政部长表示，哥伦比亚今年将减少约 20 万亿比索（约合 50 亿美元）的公共开支，因为古斯塔沃-彼得罗总统的政府在高估税收收入后面临预算限制。【原文：Colombia will reduce public spending by about 20 trillion pesos ($5 billion) this year, the finance minister said, as President Gustavo Petro’s administration faces budget restrictions after overestimating tax revenue.】

item.title: 2024 年美国公司最大规模首次公开募股后 Waystar 股价下跌
item.description: 医疗保健支付软件制造商 Waystar Holding Corp. 首次公开募股募集到 9.68 亿美元，创下今年美国公司募集资金之最，之后该公司股价下跌达 4.7%。【原文：Health-care payments software maker Waystar Holding Corp. shares declined as much as 4.7% after its initial public offering raised $968 million, the largest by a US-based company this year.】

item.title: 就业激增重燃美联储关于利率限制程度的争论
item.description: 周五令人瞠目的就业数据很可能会激起一场已经在美联储官员中产生分歧的争论，争论的焦点是美联储的政策制定是否像他们预测的那样使经济放缓。【原文：Friday’s eye-popping jobs number is likely to energize a debate already dividing Federal Reserve officials over whether their policy setting is slowing the economy as much as they had predicted.】

item.title: 奇货通讯：人们痛恨通货膨胀的简单原因？
item.description: 您好，欢迎阅读《奇货》周刊，乔-魏森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）将为您带来他们对市场、金融和经济领域最有趣发展的看法。【原文：Hello and welcome to the weekly Odd Lots newsletter, where Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway bring you their thoughts on the most interesting developments in markets, finance and the economy.】

item.title: 美联储降息押注受阻，美元升至一个月来最高点
item.description: 彭博社的一项美元强弱指数有望创下 2 月份以来最长的周连胜纪录，因为美国经济的强劲势头粉碎了人们对美联储近期政策中枢的残存希望。【原文：A Bloomberg gauge of dollar strength is on track for its longest weekly winning streak since February as the strength of the US economy crushed any remaining hopes of near-term Federal Reserve policy pivot.】

item.title: 委内瑞拉投票前通胀率降至 59% 的 10 年最低点
item.description: 由于中央银行采取干预措施吸收过剩的流动性，委内瑞拉的通货膨胀率降至 10 年来的最低点。【原文：Venezuelan inflation slowed to a 10-year low as the central bank intervenes to absorb excess liquidity.】

item.title: BCI 称私人信贷违约将清除 "游客投资者
item.description: 不列颠哥伦比亚投资管理公司（British Columbia Investment Management Corp.）预计，未来几个月违约率上升将把 "游客投资者 "赶出 1.7 万亿美元的私人信贷市场。【原文：British Columbia Investment Management Corp. expects rising defaults in coming months that will flush out “tourist investors” from the $1.7 trillion private credit market.】

item.title: 象牙海岸禁止部分可可销售，市场再遭威胁
item.description: 头号可可生产国象牙海岸（Ivory Coast）已采取措施，为当地加工商增加紧缺的供应，威胁限制可可豆出口，进一步收紧全球市场。【原文：Top cocoa producer Ivory Coast has taken steps to shore up scarce supplies for local processors, threatening to restrict bean exports and further tighten the global market.】

item.title: 前达能高管接任路威酩轩首席财务官
item.description: 伯纳德-阿诺特（Bernard Arnault）控制的奢侈品集团路威酩轩集团（LVMH）任命了其长期首席财务官的副手，为接替这一重要管理职位做准备。【原文：LVMH named a deputy to its long-time chief financial officer as the luxury group controlled by Bernard Arnault prepares for succession in the key executive role.】

item.title: 意大利开放光纤公司将获得 20 亿欧元的新债务和股权
item.description: 意大利 Open Fiber SpA 公司将获得约 20 亿欧元（22 亿美元）的新资金，以帮助其缓解财务压力。【原文：Italy’s Open Fiber SpA is set to secure about €2 billion ($2.2 billion) of fresh funds to help relieve its financial strains.】
